1. Minimize loading time: Reduce the loading times by using optimized images, fewer components, and compressed texts. 

2. Clear navigation: Make the navigation clear and exquisitely displayed on every screen. Users should not be confused while accessing the app. 

3. Optimize for different screen sizes and resolutions: Ensure the app is optimized for different screen sizes and resolutions since many users operate from different devices. 

4. Consistent design: Ensure the design is unique, consistent, and easy for users to navigate. 

5. Reduce complexity: Avoid too many components that may make the app complicated, simple and easily understandable components make an app successful. 

6. Offer seamless and quick feedback: Users want to know that their actions on the app affect the results they will get. Hence, ensure to provide quick feedback after performing an action within the app.

7. Use actionable micro-copy: Microcopy makes the app come alive, providing context and meaning to the things users interact with. Integrating actionable micro-la is essential in providing the right guidance and direction to the users.

8. Personalize your app: Allow users to customize the app to fit their preferences. It creates a sense of ownership and makes the app more functional. 

9. Continuously perform user-testing: Running tests from time to time or testing new features before launching help add new functionalities and improve the user's overall experience. 

10. Keep updating your app: Keep your app regularly updated with new features and functionalities, ensuring the app stays relevant for your users.
